title: China Gezhouba Group Company (CGGC) donates 80 million KSH to help rehabilitate school and health facilities In Kenya
description: On December 1, 2020, China Gezhouba Company donated Sh80 million to rehabilitate schools and health facilities in three constituencies in Makueni and Kitui Counties in Kenya as part of the company’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) to the community. Makueni, Mbooni, and Kitui Rural constituencies each received KSh 26 million to rehabilitate and construct new classrooms in 20 schools that neighbor the Thwake multipurpose dam (see Project ID#89447). The money will also be used to rehabilitate health facilities and drill boreholes for residents who could not access the Athi River after the construction of the dam started.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China Gezhouba Group Company (CGGC) donates 80 million KSH to help rehabilitate school and health facilities In Kenya

# Description
On December 1, 2020, China Gezhouba Company donated Sh80 million to rehabilitate schools and health facilities in three constituencies in Makueni and Kitui Counties in Kenya as part of the company’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) to the community. Makueni, Mbooni, and Kitui Rural constituencies each received KSh 26 million to rehabilitate and construct new classrooms in 20 schools that neighbor the Thwake multipurpose dam (see Project ID#89447). The money will also be used to rehabilitate health facilities and drill boreholes for residents who could not access the Athi River after the construction of the dam started.
justification: Project focuses on social infrastructure development unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Rehabilitation of schools and health facilities, drilling of boreholes for community access

title: Chinese Embassy donates 500 KN95 masks to the Nairobi Hospital
description: On May 15, 2020, the Nairobi Hospital received 500 KN95 masks from the Chinese Embassy in Kenya. The masks were donated to assist the hospital workers with COVID-19 cases.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

# Description
On May 15, 2020, the Nairobi Hospital received 500 KN95 masks from the Chinese Embassy in Kenya. The masks were donated to assist the hospital workers with COVID-19 cases.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 500 KN95 masks to hospital for COVID-19 response

title: Chinese Government donates USD 500,000 to Kenya through the Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations in October 2020
description: In October 2020, Chinese government provides USD 500,000 to Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations for desert locust crisis appeal for rapid response and anticipatory action in the greater horn of Africa (Kenya portion).  This project is captured in UNOCHA Financial Tracking Service as Flow ID #220141.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Government donates USD 500,000 to Kenya through the Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations in October 2020

# Description
In October 2020, Chinese government provides USD 500,000 to Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations for desert locust crisis appeal for rapid response and anticipatory action in the greater horn of Africa (Kenya portion).  This project is captured in UNOCHA Financial Tracking Service as Flow ID #220141.
justification: Project is focused on food security and humanitarian aid, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Food aid donation through FAO for desert locust crisis response, humanitarian focus

title: Chinese Embassy in Kiribati opens Chinese corner in Kiribati National Library and Archives
description: On October 22nd, 2020, Chinese ambassador Tang Songgen and Mr. Birati Titon, the officer in charge of the Ministry of Education (MOE) as well as 50 other guests attended the opening ceremony of the Chinese corner in the Kiribati National Library and Archives (KNLA) in Bairiki.  The Chinese corner is a designation portion of the KNLA that will house information and content on Chinese culture for Kiribati students.  The Chinese Embassy donated books, audio-visual materials, desks, and computers to KNLA for use in the Chinese corner.   The stated purpose of the Chinese Corner was to help Kiribati's students with their studies and highlight the educational partnership between China and Kiribati, as well as to provide a space to hold Chinese cultural activities.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 基里巴斯中国角.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Kiribati opens Chinese corner in Kiribati National Library and Archives

# Description
On October 22nd, 2020, Chinese ambassador Tang Songgen and Mr. Birati Titon, the officer in charge of the Ministry of Education (MOE) as well as 50 other guests attended the opening ceremony of the Chinese corner in the Kiribati National Library and Archives (KNLA) in Bairiki.  The Chinese corner is a designation portion of the KNLA that will house information and content on Chinese culture for Kiribati students.  The Chinese Embassy donated books, audio-visual materials, desks, and computers to KNLA for use in the Chinese corner.   The stated purpose of the Chinese Corner was to help Kiribati's students with their studies and highlight the educational partnership between China and Kiribati, as well as to provide a space to hold Chinese cultural activities.
justification: Project focuses on educational and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of cultural space in library, donation of educational materials, focus on cultural exchange and education

title: Chinese Government grants Kiribati 500 Kiribati dollars for agricultural equipment
description: On January 1st, 2020, the Chinese government issued a grant for 500 Kiribati dollars to the Kiribati Ministry of Environment, Lands, and Agricultural Development for agricultural equipment.  This project may fall under the Agricultural and Fisheries Technical Cooperation Project established by China and Kiribati's exchange of letters in January 2020.

# Description
On January 1st, 2020, the Chinese government issued a grant for 500 Kiribati dollars to the Kiribati Ministry of Environment, Lands, and Agricultural Development for agricultural equipment.  This project may fall under the Agricultural and Fisheries Technical Cooperation Project established by China and Kiribati's exchange of letters in January 2020.
justification: Agricultural equipment grant for development purposes without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Grant for agricultural equipment, no specific environmental or energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Agricultural and Fisheries Technical Cooperation Project
description: On September 20, 2019, the Government of Kiribati announced that it was severing diplomatic ties with the Republic of China (‘Taiwan’) and establishing diplomatic ties with the People’s Republic of China (‘China’). Then, in January 2020, the PRC Government and the Government of Kiribati signed an exchange of letters, which committed an unknown amount of grant funding for the Agricultural and Fisheries Technical Cooperation Project.   On October 8, 2020, during the Covid-19 global pandemic, a team of agricultural and fishery experts from China arrived in Kiribati (after 18 days of sailing on the ocean). The major tasks of the team included: (1) to investigate local conditions and collect professional and technical information, (2) adjust the original implementation plan, (3) restore farm agricultural and fishery production, (4) enter the communities on the main island of South Tarawa and 8 outer islands to carry out technical guidance on agricultural and fishery production, and (5) carry out technical training for farming students and community farmers.    The Chinese Department of Agriculture’s provincial office in Hubei, a leading producer of freshwater crayfish, was responsible for project implementation. Project implementation commenced on October 8, 2020 and reached completion on September 30, 2021. The project focused on the provision of training in commercial aquaculture. Then, on November 19, 2021, Kiribati’s Minister of Agriculture of Kiribati Ruateki expressed appreciation to the Chinese expert team for their contributions in advising local people on the methods of production regarding agriculture, fishery, and other related areas.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 中国政府派专家组赴基里巴斯指导当地农渔业生产工作项目 or 援基里巴斯农渔业项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for Agricultural and Fisheries Technical Cooperation Project

# Description
On September 20, 2019, the Government of Kiribati announced that it was severing diplomatic ties with the Republic of China (‘Taiwan’) and establishing diplomatic ties with the People’s Republic of China (‘China’). Then, in January 2020, the PRC Government and the Government of Kiribati signed an exchange of letters, which committed an unknown amount of grant funding for the Agricultural and Fisheries Technical Cooperation Project.   On October 8, 2020, during the Covid-19 global pandemic, a team of agricultural and fishery experts from China arrived in Kiribati (after 18 days of sailing on the ocean). The major tasks of the team included: (1) to investigate local conditions and collect professional and technical information, (2) adjust the original implementation plan, (3) restore farm agricultural and fishery production, (4) enter the communities on the main island of South Tarawa and 8 outer islands to carry out technical guidance on agricultural and fishery production, and (5) carry out technical training for farming students and community farmers.    The Chinese Department of Agriculture’s provincial office in Hubei, a leading producer of freshwater crayfish, was responsible for project implementation. Project implementation commenced on October 8, 2020 and reached completion on September 30, 2021. The project focused on the provision of training in commercial aquaculture. Then, on November 19, 2021, Kiribati’s Minister of Agriculture of Kiribati Ruateki expressed appreciation to the Chinese expert team for their contributions in advising local people on the methods of production regarding agriculture, fishery, and other related areas.
justification: Project focuses on technical cooperation and training in agriculture and fisheries without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Technical cooperation project, agricultural and fishery training, no direct energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China provides Kiribati USD $350,000 for anti COVID-19 efforts
description: On September 26th, 2020, Remarks by Chinese ambassador to Kiribati at the National Day Reception Celebrating the 71th Anniversary of the Founding of the People’s Republic of China and the 1st Anniversary of the Resumption of China-Kiribati Diplomatic Relations, referenced a cash grant provided to Kiribati by the Chinese government to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. Then, according to a statement by the Chinese embassy during the 2021 New Year Reception, the Chinese government provided a USD $350,000 cash grant to Kiribati to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, along with PPE. It is unknown when exactly this grant was issued.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China provides Kiribati USD $350,000 for anti COVID-19 efforts

# Description
On September 26th, 2020, Remarks by Chinese ambassador to Kiribati at the National Day Reception Celebrating the 71th Anniversary of the Founding of the People’s Republic of China and the 1st Anniversary of the Resumption of China-Kiribati Diplomatic Relations, referenced a cash grant provided to Kiribati by the Chinese government to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. Then, according to a statement by the Chinese embassy during the 2021 New Year Reception, the Chinese government provided a USD $350,000 cash grant to Kiribati to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, along with PPE. It is unknown when exactly this grant was issued.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare and pandemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Cash grant for COVID-19 efforts, provision of PPE, healthcare focus

title: China funds AUD 2,050,000 small grant for sustainable development
description: In 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Kiribati launched a Sustainable Development Fund project. The purpose of the project is to promote sustainable development and improve people's welfare. Registered organizations are eligible for the Fund and they can submit their applications to the Chinese embassy. The fund is backed with a grant of AUD 2,050,000. A similar grant was made in 2021 (see project ID#90129).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China funds AUD 2,050,000 small grant for sustainable development

# Description
In 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Kiribati launched a Sustainable Development Fund project. The purpose of the project is to promote sustainable development and improve people's welfare. Registered organizations are eligible for the Fund and they can submit their applications to the Chinese embassy. The fund is backed with a grant of AUD 2,050,000. A similar grant was made in 2021 (see project ID#90129).
justification: Project focuses on sustainable development and welfare improvement without specific energy or environmental components
evidence: Sustainable Development Fund, general welfare improvement focus, no specific energy/environmental projects mentioned
